description: This source file implements the DownloadManagerHttpClient class, which handles HTTP file downloads using libcurl. It initializes curl, manages download progress, supports rate limiting, handles errors, and performs cleanup.

classes.name: DownloadManagerHttpClient
classes.description: A class responsible for managing HTTP downloads, utilizing libcurl for network operations, download progress tracking, error handling, and resource management.

methods.name: DownloadManagerHttpClient()
methods.description: Constructor that initializes the curl handle and sets up initial states.

methods.name: ~DownloadManagerHttpClient()
methods.description: Destructor that cleans up curl resources.

methods.name: DownloadManagerHttpClient::Status downloadFile(const std::string & url,const std::string & fileName,uint32_t rateLimit)
methods.description: Performs the download of a file from a specified URL to a given filename with optional rate limiting.

methods.name: size_t progressCb(void * ptr,double dltotal,double dlnow,double ultotal,double ulnow)
methods.description: Callback function for tracking download progress, updating the progress percentage, and checking for cancellation requests.

methods.name: size_t write_data(void * ptr,size_t size,size_t nmemb,FILE * stream)
methods.description: Callback function to write downloaded data into a file stream.

ctags.name: progressCb
ctags.pattern: /^size_t DownloadManagerHttpClient::progressCb(void *ptr, double dltotal, double dlnow, double ult/
